field.name: summary
field.value: WCF: Add support for WcfFacility to run in partial trust mode

field.name: description
field.value:
When using the WcfFacility in a partial trust XBAP a security exception is thrown when creating an async channel. Exception demanded: System.Security.Permissions.SecurityAction.InheritanceDemand AsyncChannelFactoryBuilder.cs: Line 48
This one can be mitigated by setting WantsAsyncCapability = false.
The second error occurs at WCFChannelHolder.cs: Line 36 System.Security.SecurityException occurred Message=Request for the permission of type 'System.Security.Permissions.SecurityPermission, mscorlib, Version=2.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089' failed. Source=Castle.Facilities.WcfIntegration StackTrace: at Castle.Facilities.WcfIntegration.WcfChannelHolder.CreateChannel() at Castle.Facilities.WcfIntegration.WcfChannelHolder..ctor(ChannelCreator channelCreator, IWcfBurden burden, Nullable`1 closeTimeout) InnerException:
It's a link demand error but I can't seem to nail down where it's erroring out. CreateChannel() is a private method inside the class so i don't know why that would throw a link error.
Steps to recreate: Create a Partial Trust XBAP project Setup Windsor and the WcfFacility Component.For<ISecurityService>() .AsWcfClient( new DefaultClientModel( WcfEndpoint.FromConfiguration("WSHttpBinding_ISecurityService") ).WithoutAsyncCapability() ), Request a channel.
I'll keep tinkering with it and see if I can figure it out.
Raul
